intro: Zosima depauperata, commonly known as the poor zosima, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
